intro: Chorizanthe vaginata var. arida, commonly known as desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, with deep roots and a low water requirement. Its structure and growth pattern make it a resilient plant in sandy and rocky soils.
